problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous lecture video clips.
Which of the following are true?

choice.text: Any Pauli element may be represented by a [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {Z}_2[/mathjaxinline] vector of size n.
The symplectic group is the group of matrices over [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {Z}_2[/mathjaxinline] that preserve the symplectic inner product.
In the linear algebra perspective the conjugation of a Pauli element with a Clifford unitary is captured by two linear forms.
Any permutation matrix is a member of the symplectic group.
